channel.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
channel.description:
oh hai der, i have been practicing with lin's interface editor/emulator tool and i must say im getting the hang of it. I have recreated the 474 skill interface to about 90% accuracy(the only errors might be the positions of the hover boxes and the color of them). other than that i would say its basically perfect.
If anyone wishes to use this, download this file, inside will be 2 sprites which you need to pack into the cache.
the image archive name is staticons2, pack the sprites into that archive in the exact position as the name of the sprite, 4 and 5 etc.
anyway, heres the link: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?oef1225nhsnn9s6]474 skill interface(non hardcoded)[/url]
here is a video, i fail at making GIFs.
[URL=http://s551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/?action=view&current=clipwmv0014.mp4][IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/th_clipwmv0014.jpg[/img][/URL]
Additional information:
If you are using any hard coded interface with the id or child ids of 18787 - 18900, you will have bugs using this interface as by default, lin's tool sets the id to 18787+
There are no sendquests(or sendframe126s) needed, the hunter and construction skill level things are calculated client sided, the only server sided part you need to do is add 2 more skills to your character files, skill 21 and skill 22 are construction and hunter. You may, however, need to add hunter or construction to the server method that calculates total level.
I hope you guys enjoy! Oh and post a comment if you used this.. :o

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

I Vain I:

Fixed, thank very much.

Youre welcome.

EDIT: just discovered a bug… it seems that the total doesnt include hunter and construction… ill look into adding those if i can figure out how.

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

make sure you pack the sprites into staticons2 (there is staticons, and staticons2), the hunter icon needs to go in slot4, and the construction one needs to go in slot5.

Also, when packing anything, even sprites, you have to repack the archive after finishing.

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Noo.
It was my coding.

I messed with the Sprite class, and it messed up my interfaces.[/quote]

oh, what were you trying to do?

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Well, I tried doing some things to PI client, and I also tried this.

When I logged in, all my interfaces were messed up.[/quote]

i dont use PI clients, they have more problems than benefits imo. But i guess i can link your problem with the file, if you have any hard coded interfaces that have ids or child ids 18787 - 18900, you will either have to remove them, change their ids, or just dont use this file. You did make a backup of your data.dat right?

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Just wondering, if I didn’t replace the data.dat file, would anything happen to the client?

Cause I did some coding/this, and didn’t do the data.dat, and now my client is fucked. :([/quote]

the data.dat is basically interface configs, if you left it how it is, everything would still be the old 317 version.
Mind telling me exactly how your client is “fucked”?

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]What do you mean, pack the interface file? :S

All I did was add the images to the archive, and clicked save, then I closed the cache.

What else needs to be done, client sided?[/quote]

take the data.dat file that is in the download, go to edit jagex archices, scroll down to interface.jag, open that, and replace that file.

save cache and then check out the interface

Read full topic

item.title: 474 skill interface(non hardcoded)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]So, all I have to do is pack the images?

Do I have to add anything else to the client, or server to make this work? (Besides the skill tokens/methods)[/quote]

everything is client sided, just pack the hunter and construction sprites into staticons2 in the position as their names, pack the interface file into your cache and boom. The sprites are included in the download so you dont have to search for them.

Make a backup of your interface file first so if anything goes wrong you can always switch back.
the construction skill id is 21, and the hunter is 22.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“recker450, post:2, topic:357350”]good job
and why is your client flashing?
the map blinking in parts of the screen and stuff?[/quote]

my computer is the cause, it does it to every 317 client i run.
so its not a problem with the client
